info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:02PM CDT until June 23 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR LUBBOCK AND SOUTHEASTERN HOCKLEY COUNTIES... At 602 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lubbock South Plains Mall, or 4 miles west of Lubbock, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Slaton, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Idalou, Ransom Canyon, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Texas Tech University, Lubbock International Airport, Slide, Downtown Lubbock, Woodrow, Reese Center, New Deal, Smyer, Buffalo Springs, Ropesville and Lubbock Science Spectrum. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
